definition: to go/to take/sentence-final interrogative particle/variant of 於|于[yu2]

sentences.english: The animals were ruthlessly hunted to the verge of extinction.
sentences.chinese: 这些动物由于遭到无情的捕猎而濒于灭绝。

sentences.english: This long-drawn-out war brought their country's finance to the verge of bankruptcy.
sentences.chinese: 这场旷日持久的战争使他们国家财政濒于破产的边缘。

sentences.english: These passions , in a wayward course, over a deep ocean of anguish, reaching to the very verge of despair.
sentences.chinese: 这些激情像飓风，反复地深重的苦海，濒于绝境。

sentences.english: The Fatimid State in Egypt was on the verge of total disintegration in the period before Saladin's arrival.
sentences.chinese: 埃及的法蒂玛王朝在萨拉丁到来前濒于完全崩溃。

sentences.english: In 1972, it was discovered that they are endangered. (P119)
sentences.chinese: 1972年，人们发现它们已经濒于灭绝。

sentences.english: Other way around, will lead to the downfall of your Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 否则，你的王朝将濒于瓦解。

sentences.english: The chimpanzee is an endangered species .
sentences.chinese: 黑猩猩是濒于灭种的动物。
